quotes: Then he worked as director of the Africa and Middle East Division in Tanzania’s Ministry of Foreign Affairs and as ambassador to the People’s Republic of China (1969).
During his appointment in 1970 as Tanzania’s Permanent Representative to the UN, he served as the focal point for several of the institutions that played key roles in the liberation struggle.

Formed during the 1963 OAU Conference of Heads of State and Government in Addis Ababa, the Liberation Committee became the OAU’s coordinating mechanism for harmonising and implementing African initiatives against colonialism and apartheid.

organizations.name: UN Special Committee on the Situation with Regard to the Implementation of the Declaration on the Granting of Independence to Colonial Countries and Peoples (UN Special Committee on Decolonization)
quotes: These were the OAU’s Coordinating Committee for the Liberation of Africa (Liberation Committee); the UN Special Committee on the Situation with Regard to the Implementation of the Declaration on the Granting of Independence to Colonial Countries and Peoples (UN Special Committee on Decolonization);

organizations.name: Coalition of the Frontline States (FLS)
quotes: These were the OAU’s Coordinating Committee for the Liberation of Africa (Liberation Committee); the UN Special Committee on the Situation with Regard to the Implementation of the Declaration on the Granting of Independence to Colonial Countries and Peoples (UN Special Committee on Decolonization); and the Coalition of the Frontline States (FLS).

organizations.name: OAU
quotes: Formed during the 1963 OAU Conference of Heads of State and Government in Addis Ababa, the Liberation Committee became the OAU’s coordinating mechanism for harmonising and implementing African initiatives against colonialism and apartheid.

organizations.name: Mulungushi Club
quotes: An immediate predecessor to the FLS coalition, the Mulungushi Club was an informal grouping of heads of state from Tanzania, Zambia, Uganda and the then Zaire (Democratic Republic of the Congo [DRC]), which all took an interest in advancing the liberation of the southern African states.
